item.title: Report X-2024080689
item.description:
Report X-2024080689

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging was torn on the seam of the box. The only label that is present on the box is the orientation arrows. Inside is a 5 gallon plastic jerrican containing a 10 kg worth or approximately 2.5 gallons of Metarom's Alcohol Booster Flavor Type Natural. There are no visible damage to the inner package. It was secured with a duct tape which held the jerrican from getting damage.

item.title: Report X-2024080487
item.description:
Report X-2024080487

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET ON ONE SIDE WITH A HOLE. PACKAGE IMPROPERLY SORTED AT WRLT AND SACR, PACKAGE PLACED NOT RIGHT SIDE UP. ONE BOTTLE LEAKED A VERY MINOR AMOUNT FROM CAP THAT WAS JUST FINGERTIGHT AND LEAKING SEAL. SPILL ISOLALATED TO PACKAGING. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024080630
item.description:
Report X-2024080630

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: LATHROP
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SAW THAT ONE OF THE GALLONS WAS EMPTIED OUT AND WAS SPREAD OUT ALL OVER THE AREA. A PH TEST AND SOME INSIGHT FROM THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET HELPED RESPONDER CLEAN UP THE SPILL. AS SOON AS THE CLEAN UP WAS FINISHED, RESPONDER IMMEDIATELY HEADED BACK TO THE CAGE TO BEGIN WORKING ON THE HAZARD.

item.title: Report X-2024080587
item.description:
Report X-2024080587

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: VICTORVILLE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations.This was a 3 piece shipment with one declared dg package and two that were non hazardous. The two boxes in question were suspected to be DG. One contained machiner parts and the other was Concealed DG inside a brown fiberboard box. The cylinder inside was marked as UN 1057 with 1090 psig; 7167kPa. There was no release and the shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024072493
item.description:
Report X-2024072493

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was dropped down a chute and caused package to go sideways and cap to come loose and leak out. QA-admin discovered package leaking and placed the leaky package inside a hazmat bag with absorbent. QA-admin then cleaned up spill with absorbent and out the cleanup absorbent inside the hazmat bag was well. Bag was then placed inside and placed inside a hazmat tote to the Hazmat Processing cage for further processing. Hazmat Package is missing OP-900 and Hazmat Certificate paperwork. So, cannot approve for HAP.

item.title: Report X-2024072499
item.description:
Report X-2024072499

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: TEMECULA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/30/2024 at approximately 1330, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 154002 at the station location in Temecula, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic jug packaged in a FedEx padded pack. The commidity was discovered leaking from the closure, resulting in spillage that compromised the outer labeling. Based off the product name, Dangerous Goods Administration located an online safety data sheet, idnetifying the commodity as UN 3082 Environmentally hazardous substance, n.o.s.; however, the shipment was not properly packaged in strong rigid outer packaging, which voided the use of Special Provision A197. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.description:
Report E-2024080127

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: HAYWARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that "FORMULA 6410" UN1816 was released from a 5-gallon plastic jug due to a puncture. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released affecting a 12' x 4' area trailer floor and a 30’ x 3’ area beneath the trailer. The contractor collected and containerized the FORMULA 6410 and all clean-up debris into one (1) 30-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2024080333

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came out of trailer 840669 in a wet, deteriorated state. Package was placed in a tote for QA. upon inspection, contents is a bottle of Decal stat that had a loose cap, causing its liquid content to spill out which in time deteriorated a small portion of the package. While the package had filling to prevent movement on the body, there was minimal to none for the cap, which if properly protected, would have not become loose during movement.

item.title: Report X-2024080317
item.description:
Report X-2024080317

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was observed to be wet when package handler prepared to unload it from trailer. QA admin was called to the scene and placed the package in line HazMat tote. Aside from this carton being wet, there was little evidence of any spill inside trailer. No other packages were affected and admin cleaned up the area where the package had been with neutralizer as a precaution. Internal bottle had a loose cap, it also presents visually as having been crushed or compressed on opposite sides of the bottle, though there's no sign of the outer carton having been impacted adversely. Though the package carton presented wet, none of the bottles inside were, and the labeling on the bottles show no sign of having made contact with corrosive mixture. Body of bottle which lost content is intact, there is no sign of leakage there.

item.description:
Report E-2024080104

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-12ft area of the trailer floor and concrete underneath the trailer and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to a forklift damaging two (2) plastic jugs. Clean Harbors personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify only two (2) jugs were damaged, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged boxes, jugs, and recovered material were placed into two (2) 30-gallon poly drums and one (1) 16-gallon poly drum for disposal.
